p: Product persistence in the field is a known agricultural challenge. Products are easily degraded by light or microorganisms, or they undergo hydrolysis. Photodegradation is the most common process in pesticides [ 46]. In a study involving chitosan-coated beeswax-based nanoparticles containing deltamethrin, 37.3% of the product had not been degraded after 24 h of UV light irradiation, whereas 85% of the free form degraded under similar conditions [ 47].
